channel.title: Why should I use linux?
channel.description:
I would love to use linux, the concept is great, but I cant switch. Here's what's stopping me: - Games aren't available on linux, don't say wine, etc. - The GUI, yes, its customizable, and yes, I've spent time customizing it, but theres stuff thats just inevitable, like the choppy font rendering and some applications not using proper colors. (xchat menu becoming invisible) - Guitar effect processors don't function well, such as GNUitar, which runs great on windows but crap on linux, even though it's made for linux. - I'll have to get used to an IDE that runs in linux, as JBuilder is discontinued.
These are only a few things, I'm sure theres more I've forgotten about. So why should I use linux? Theres a lot of cons, and I can't think of any good reason to switch. Also, don't say stupid shit like mopar does, "it can store more files because its case sensitive." I don't give a shit.

item.title: Why should I use linux?
item.dc:creator: @JukuG JukuG
item.description:
@JukuG wrote:

[quote=“juju, post:19, topic:146611”]The main reason that I prefer to use Linux over Windows is:

  • Package manager
  • I play very few games, only WoW really - which runs perfectly by the way.
  • Most of the stuff I need is there by default. eg; perl
  • I like minimal UI - openbox

Windows is great too, but, I prefer Linux. If I had the money, I’d be in OS X land, but since I am a humble fry boy, that will not be happening in the near future.[/quote]

Glad to hear good comments.

Read full topic

item.title: Why should I use linux?
item.dc:creator: @juju juju
item.description:
@juju wrote:

The main reason that I prefer to use Linux over Windows is:

  • Package manager
  • I play very few games, only WoW really - which runs perfectly by the way.
  • Most of the stuff I need is there by default. eg; perl
  • I like minimal UI - openbox

Windows is great too, but, I prefer Linux. If I had the money, I’d be in OS X land, but since I am a humble fry boy, that will not be happening in the near future.

oh, and patch and diff are awesome - I know there are proberly versions for Windows, but, it doesn’t come by default.

Read full topic

item.title: Why should I use linux?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Linux is more stable, faster, more configurable, looks much better in my opinion (KDE, not GNOME) and plenty of more things that make it better than windows. But if you don’t agree then just stick with what you like.

Silver Lining:

Really, memory usage comparisons can’t be done with Linux and Windows when you’re talking about Linux in general. I could use DSL and have almost all of my memory free, or I could use *ubuntu and have almost all of my memory in use.

Obviously you have to compare fairly, kubuntu takes up less ram than windows for me as well.

Read full topic

lawl if as you say you have no real need for linux then why ask to keep it?

because everyone says its so great

lol, well in that case you could just have it installed as a multiboot. It’s not like you HAVE to use it sometimes.
[/quote]
i already said that i have it as multiboot, anyway, i dont HAVE to use it, and i wont use it, because theres no reason to use it, unless someone gives me a good one[/quote]

lol, not to be an ass or a prick, but why have it around if your not going to use it? I mean just delete it and add more space to your XP

item.title: Why should I use linux?
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

If Windows is working fine for you, then I don’t see any reason to switch to Linux really. People say it’s faster but I personally never noticed any difference in speed from Windows XP (although I’ve done a lot of tweaking to my Windows XP). There’s normally no hassle running games in Windows, in Linux you’d have to use WINE. Windows looks better in my opinion too.

Anyway, I’m sure I could think of more but I have to go make dinner, ciao.

Read full topic

item.title: Why should I use linux?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

For general use? because in my opinion it runs a lot faster, starts up faster, looks much better, and has a general better feel for it.
Maybe because linux does not start up a ton of processes on start up.

We could always use the one of those gay ‘tales’:
“REAL HACKERS USE LINUX”
“I AM INVULNERABLE TO VIRUS’S ON LINUX!”

item.title: Why should I use linux?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I have had the xchat menu disappear on me before too, even in windows. I believe it is F11 you are looking for, annoying ain’t it?

I have never had choppy font rendering, I am not sure what you are referring to, are your graphics drivers installed?

I don’t know anything about the guitar program, but choppy sound sounds like a driver issue, probably configured wrong.

Any decent IDE for java will run on linux, IDEA, netbeans, eclipse. I use KDevelop for native code and even compile native windows executables with it.

Even I keep windows for games, but there are also plenty of games for linux and they run much smoother faster and better. Nexuiz, every ID game (which are the best games really) and a few I have here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/linuxtorrents/

Read full topic

that, and which system ticks you off the most…

item.title: Why should I use linux?
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

I personally use it to be 1337er. If you want to use Linux, go ahead, if you don’t, stick with windows like to other 99% percent of people It’s essentially your choice to decide the pros and cons of an operating system.

Read full topic

item.title: Why should I use linux?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

*Pulls a moparisthebest
ITS OPEN SOURCE !1!!!11!1

Anyway, i use linux for most things but i keep windows on a multi boot if i ever need it for anything then i have it.
As for your IDE problem there is always programs like Kate and eclipse.

The things you have stated are most of the things that was stopping me from trying linux, and to be honest i did not like it much at first but as i got used to it, started playing around finding more programs and such then i started to love it.

Read full topic

item.title: Why should I use linux?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I would love to use linux, the concept is great, but I cant switch.
Here’s what’s stopping me:

  • Games aren’t available on linux, don’t say wine, etc.
  • The GUI, yes, its customizable, and yes, I’ve spent time customizing it, but theres stuff thats just inevitable, like the choppy font rendering and some applications not using proper colors. (xchat menu becoming invisible)
  • Guitar effect processors don’t function well, such as GNUitar, which runs great on windows but crap on linux, even though it’s made for linux.
  • I’ll have to get used to an IDE that runs in linux, as JBuilder is discontinued.

These are only a few things, I’m sure theres more I’ve forgotten about.
So why should I use linux? Theres a lot of cons, and I can’t think of any good reason to switch.
Also, don’t say stupid shit like mopar does, “it can store more files because its case sensitive.” I don’t give a shit.
